1.text: After the Sabbath, at dawn on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary went to see the tomb.

2.text: Suddenly there was a great earthquake, for an angel of the Lord descended from heaven, rolled away the stone, and sat on it.

3.text: His appearance was like lightning, and his clothes were white as snow.

4.text: The guards trembled in fear of him and became like dead men.

5.text: But the angel said to the women, “Do not be afraid, for I know that you are looking for Jesus, who was crucified.

6.text: He is not here; He has risen, just as He said! Come, see the place where He lay.

7.text: Then go quickly and tell His disciples, ‘He has risen from the dead and is going ahead of you into Galilee. There you will see Him.’ See, I have told you.”

8.text: So they hurried away from the tomb in fear and great joy, and ran to tell His disciples.

9.text: Suddenly Jesus met them and said, “Greetings!” They came to Him, grasped His feet, and worshiped Him.

10.text: “Do not be afraid,” said Jesus. “Go and tell My brothers to go to Galilee. There they will see Me.”

11.text: While the women were on their way, some of the guards went into the city and reported to the chief priests all that had happened.

12.text: And after the chief priests had met with the elders and formed a plan, they gave the soldiers a large sum of money

13.text: and instructed them: “You are to say, ‘His disciples came by night and stole Him away while we were asleep.’

14.text: If this report reaches the governor, we will satisfy him and keep you out of trouble.”

15.text: So the guards took the money and did as they were instructed. And this account has been circulated among the Jews to this very day.

16.text: Meanwhile, the eleven disciples went to Galilee, to the mountain Jesus had designated.

17.text: When they saw Him, they worshiped Him, but some doubted.

18.text: Then Jesus came to them and said, “All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to Me.

19.text: Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,

20.text: and teaching them to obey all that I have commanded you. And surely I am with you always, even to the end of the age.”
